title: If a dead web page isn't archived by Wayback Machine, is it literally gone forever without a trace? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. The Wayback Machine is not the only entity which might archive copies of web pages. Search engines might have copies cached. Other web services might have made copies. Individual users might have made a copy of a page for fun. To assert that a web page is “literally gone forever without a trace” is to attempt to prove a negative, which is impossible in most practical cases.
Was the website British? If so, it may be archived on: UKWA Home Web caching is expensive, though, and so very few organizations do it formally.
